ARCWriterProcessor has a 'pool-max-active' setting, default 5, which 
sets how many ARC files will be opened at once, if all previously opened 
ARC files are busy when a thread needs to write a resource.

Setting this to 1 ensures no extra ARC files will be created due to 
contention. (Alternatively, you could set the mximumum number of threads 
to 1.)

(We're unsure if the writing of multiple ARC files in parallel on a 
single disk, where they still have to contend for the disk head, offers 
a real performance benefit; work to profile this question and/or 
simplify the pool mechanism to minimize the creation of <100MB ARCs 
would be a welcome contribution.)

- Gordon @ IA

joeyfreund wrote:
> Hi there
> 
> I am running a few small crawls -
> * Each crawl has about 100 seeds from the same host
> * I am using a crawl-depth limit of 0 (crawl the page and its 
> dependencies, but don't go any deeper)
> * I am using a time limit of 1 hour
> * The size limit of an ARC file is set to be 100MB
> 
> For some reason each crawl ends up creating about 5 ARC files (about 
> 1MB each) instead of a single ARC file (as I expected, since the crawls 
> are fairly small).
> 
> Any insights as to why that is happening?
> Can I force Heritrix to use a single file for each crawl?
